Notes: the vegan cashew ricotta is the best I've ever had. the sauce is amazing. this pizza is incredible

this pizza really hit the spot. a classic combo of pineapple, vegan pepperoni, and jalapeno. basically what I would put on a pizza if I was making it from scratch. nailed it in basically every category

a lot of things are right about this pizza. the toppings are amazing, preserved eggplant, onions, great sauce. the crust was perfect it can't get better, but it can be equally good and different. the only thing that could have made it better is a little heat. some hot oil would have done the trick
crust is so unique and delicious. it is like a dessert pie crust. very rich. all the ingredients are incredibly fresh. they definitely live up to their story

great vegan options. caramelized onion sauce was a pretty major letdown. I was quite excited, but it was basically non-existent. slicing sucked. long and skinny aslices no one wants that. would definitely go back want to try all the vegan options

on a different night would probably have been number 1 so far. they forgot my spicy cashew cream which was a big minus for them because that would have been a key ingredient. the rest of the toppings were good, but had too much salsa flavor. their crust was perfect as usual
everything was good. Nothing stood out.
really good. I think the pan style crust is not my thing, but this was still very good

not the best for vegan options. very tangy, but not in a bad way. tangy in the crust and the sauce. really positive message with living wage fee and I support their mission to provide a living wage to their workers. would eat here again, but might try different toppings
they gave me a free beer while I waited for my pizza so that was a great message. too much vegan cheese which made the crust soggy, otherwise decent flavor
